content.description: Start sitting with the right hand using an obvious pocket at 3.5 feet and the left hand on an edge six inches lower. Use the arete to gain the lip above, where an easy top out awaits.Â While short, the combination of cool holds and movement make this one worth doing. As the name implies, you may need to do some barnacle removal to make some of the footholds usable.
content.protection: One pad, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: This climb is located on the south face of the boulder and is easily identified by the pocket starting hold.

content.description: This small boulder offers a few different options, but the standout line is 'Barnacle Battle' (v2/3), a short, but fun line with some cool holds and movement. This boulder must be climbed within an hour or two of low tide. It is under water at high tide.
